    		Undergraduate Admissions
    	At the heart of the tree-filled college town of Chico, California, Chico State is a nationally recognized public university and a 20-time US News & World Report Top Public School in the West.
days left to apply for fall 2023!Application extended to June 1, 2023, for domestic students. International applicant deadline is May 1, 2023.

                    'Cats in the WildBri Sieders ('22)One of just 40 of 600 applicants, Bri Siders was selected to Super Bowl LVI. The recreation, hospitality and parks management major put her years of coursework and co-curricular involvement into real-world application.Jaime Lopez ('22)After completing a master’s degree in biological sciences, first-generation college student Jaime Lopez's California Sea Grant Fellowship is taking his next step toward working for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.Erika Muniz ('22)After completing a degree in computer animation and game development, Erika Muniz works for Halon Entertainment where she uses her skills in 3-D modeling and photogrammetry to create authentic gaming experiences for women and people of color. Dare to Pursue Your PassionConfident, capable, and connected, Chico State Wildcats graduate ready to do and dare in their careers. In addition to a 100% job-placement rate for many programs, alums report an average starting salary of over $55,000 within 6 months of graduation! Take the Next StepsHow to ApplyTake a tourRequest InformationContact Undergraduate Admissions: Call us Monday–Friday, 8 a.m.–5 p.m., to talk directly to an admissions expert. Or use live chat during our open hours. No automated voice messages—we promise!530-898-6322, info@csuchico.edu.Graduate Studies  |  International StudentsWe acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, the Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus.We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.MenuChico State HomeAboutAcademicsAdmissionsCost & AidStudent LifeAcademic DepartmentsAthleticsAlumniParentsChico FactsGiveResourcesQuicklinksCampus CalendarCampus SafetyJob OpportunitiesAccessibility Resource CenterAnnual Security Report (PDF)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
